title: What is the meaning of the text about meditation and contemplation from the life of Milarépa?
first_phrase: In this final 200 tokens, the text explores various methods and techniques used in schools of meditation and contemplation, including invoking the "Goddess-Ardent-Feminine-of-the-Lightning-God" as a means of achieving a state of "vacancy" and achieving inner calmness. The text also references Mílarepa, who has made contact with the forces of the storm and sought to transform its state of turmoil into a state of tranquillity. The text concludes with a discussion of the principle and basis of contemplation, specifically the simple point without dimensionality, and the disappearance of the contemplator in contemplation.

last_phrase: In conclusion, achieving a state of calmness during a real contact, and not just an emotion, can help us calm the storm within ourselves. We must overcome the "demons of perception" and reach a state of inner "vacation" to penetrate the sense of "heart liberation," which is the key to contemplation and meditation. Through discipline and enlightenment, we can purify our intentions and achieve a stable state of meditation, leading to success and the disappearance of temporal attachments.
